patient_id: 001,"Patient complains of persistent fatigue, swelling, and severe pain in both knee and wrist joints, worsening in the morning. Physical examination revealed warmth and tenderness in affected joints. Diagnosed with rheumatoid arthritis. Started on Methotrexate 10mg weekly and Prednisone 5mg daily. Follow-up in 4 weeks with rheumatologist."

002,"Patient presents with severe, persistent cough, shortness of breath, and fever (38.5Â°C) for 3 days. Lung auscultation revealed crackles in the lower right lobe. Chest X-ray indicates consolidation consistent with pneumonia. Started on Azithromycin 500mg daily for 5 days and advised rest and hydration. Follow-up with GP in 7 days or sooner if symptoms worsen."

003,"Routine check-up. Patient reports no major complaints. Blood pressure 120/80 mmHg. Cholesterol levels stable. Advised to continue current diet and exercise regimen. Next annual physical in 12 months."

004,"Patient reports persistent headaches and occasional dizziness over the last month. No vision changes or numbness. Blood pressure slightly elevated at 145/95 mmHg. Advised to monitor BP daily for a week and return for review. Lifestyle modifications including reduced sodium intake recommended."
005,"Follow-up for type 2 diabetes. Blood glucose readings show good control. No new symptoms. Continue Metformin 1000mg twice daily. Next appointment in 3 months with fasting blood work."
